benchmark_details.name: REFCHECKER
benchmark_details.overview: REFCHECKER is a framework that introduces claim-triplets to represent claims in LLM responses, aiming to detect fine-grained hallucinations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an automated framework for detecting hallucinations in outputs generated by large language models.
out_of_scope_uses: Real-time hallucination detection in production systems

methods: Checker for evaluating claims against references
methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the ratio of claims per response classified as Entailment, Neutral, or Contradiction.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better hallucination detection performance.
methodology.validation: Conducted using human evaluation against responses from seven different LLMs.

targeted_risks.harm: Possibility of misleading users with hallucinated content.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Ensured through use of publicly accessible datasets and compliance with licensing.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data from NQ, MS MARCO, and databricks-dolly-15k are used which are under Creative Commons licenses.
